name: Lost for Words! 20 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Gimme a ticket for an aeroplane
Ain't got time to take a fast train
Lonely days are gone, I'm a-goin' home
My baby, just-a wrote me a ______"
So what did she write?
questions.explanation:
letter.

	These lyrics come from "The Letter", a 1967 hit for US group The Box Tops.A chart topper in the US, the single peaked at #5 in the UK.

questions.text:
"You're the one that I ______ ooo-ooo-ooo, honey 
The one that I ______ ooo-ooo-ooo, honey"
Remember this song from the movie "Grease"?
questions.explanation:
want.

	Olivia Newton-John and John Travolta dueted with these lyrics in the movie "Grease". "You 're the One That I Want" achieved the pinnacle of chart success in both the US and UK.

questions.text:
"Never been a sinner I never sinned 
I got a friend in Jesus 
So you know that when I die 
He's gonna set me up with 
The spirit in the ______" 
Where is that elusive spirit?
questions.explanation:
sky.

	These words are from "Spirit In The Sky" a UK chart topper for Norman Greenbaum in 1970.This song has topped the UK charts three times. The other occasions were in 1986 for Doctor and the Medics, and 2003 for Gareth Gates and the Kumars.

questions.text:
"Fighting soldiers from the sky 
Fearless men who jump and die 
Men who mean just what they say 
The brave men of the ______ Beret"
What colour was the beret?
questions.explanation:
Green.

	"Ballad Of The Green Berets" was a hit for Sgt. Barry Sadler in 1966.The song, written by Sgt. Barry Sadler And Robin Moore, topped the US chart, peaking at #24 in the UK.

questions.text:
"She talks kind'a lazy 
And people say she she's crazy 
And her life's a mystery 
Oh, but Love grows where my ______ goes 
And nobody knows like me"
A female name is missing from this lyric!
questions.explanation:
Rosemary.

	The UK group Edison Lighthouse had a hit with these lyrics from the song "Love Grows Where My Rosemary Goes".This 1970 single was a chart topper in the UK.

questions.text:
"Lies a body just oozin' life 
And someone's sneakin' 'round the corner 
Could that someone be ______ the Knife?"
This time a man's name is missing!
questions.explanation:
Mack.

	These lines come from "Mack The Knife", a 1959 hit for Bobby Darin.This song, which features in Kurt Weill's "Threepenny Opera", reached the top of the charts in both the US and UK.

questions.text:
"I found a lucky ______
I'd toss it across the bay 
Your love is worth all the gold on earth 
No wonder that I say"
So, what lucky item did Elvis toss across the bay?
questions.explanation:
penny.

	"Good Luck Charm" was a hit for Elvis Presley in 1962.Elvis took this track to the top of the charts on both sides of the Atlantic.

questions.text:
"When I find myself in times of trouble 
Mother ______ comes to me 
Speaking words of wisdom, let it be" 
Who offers comfort in this song?
questions.explanation:
Mary.

	This Beatles track, "Let It Be", featured on the album of the same name.The 1970 single topped the US chart peaking at #2 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Who's ______ now, who's ______ now 
Whose heart is achin' for breakin' each vow 
Who's sad and blue, who's cryin' too 
Just like I cried over you"
These lyrics come from an oldie-but-goody.
questions.explanation:
sorry.

	"Who's Sorry Now" was a 1958 single by Connie Francis.US born Connie, real name Concetta Franconero, topped the UK charts with this classic track.

questions.text:
"And we're goin' to ______ City, 'cause it's two to one
You know we're goin' to ______ City, gonna have some fun"
What is the name of this exciting city?
questions.explanation:
Surf.

	Jan and Dean hit the charts with these lyrics from "Surf City" in 1963.The song, written by Jan Berry and Brian Wilson, was a US #1, peaking at #26 in the UK.
